snippet: A report, commissioned in response to the phone-hacking scandal and released Wednesday, offered a window into the relationship between the news media and the Metropolitan Police Service.
abstract: British report, result of investigation into the relationship between the news media and Metropolitan Police Service, advises London police officers to avoid letting journalists ply them with alcohol in effort to get them to 'spill the beans'; study was commissioned in response to phone-hacking scandal that led to the closing of disgraced tabloid The News of the World.
lead_paragraph: A report, commissioned in response to the phone-hacking scandal and released Wednesday, offered a window into the relationship between the news media and the Metropolitan Police Service.
